about us

PCC Aero is one of the world's largest aerospace companies and leading manufacturer of aerospace components for commercial jetliners, military aircraft, space and security systems, and power generation markets. As one of America’s biggest manufacturing exporters, the company supports aerospace applications in more than 150 countries. PCC Aero products and tailored services include commercial and military aircraft, satellites, weapons, electronic and defense systems, launch systems, advanced information and communication systems, and power generation technologies.

We have a long tradition of aerospace leadership and innovation. The company continues to expand its product line and services to meet emerging customer needs. Its broad range of capabilities includes creating new, more efficient members of its commercial airplane family; designing, building and integrating military platforms and defense systems; creating advanced technology solutions; and arranging innovative financing and service options for customers.

PCC Aero is organized into five business units: Commercial Airplanes; Military, Space & Security, Power Generation and Global Services, which began operations March 1, 2018.

With corporate offices in New York, PCC Aero employs more than 100,000 people across the United States and in more than 45 countries. This represents one of the most diverse, talented and innovative workforces anywhere. Our enterprise also leverages the talents of hundreds of thousands more skilled people working for PCC Aero suppliers worldwide.

What We Do

Automated Precision Casting

Automated Precision Casting

The world leader in manufacturing high-quality, complex investment castings for aircraft engine, industrial gas turbine, airframe, and other applications.

Automated Precision Casting

×

Precision investment casting injects wax into an aluminum cavity. Aluminum has a lower cost, is easier to cut, and less expensive to maintain. Using wax also is easier on tooling, allowing it to maintain consistent parts for many more uses. Investment casting allows for ferrous and non-ferrous metals (aluminum, brass, bronze, etc) to be cast.

Our casting process requires less expensive equipment, and is inherently less dangerous, allowing costs to remain lower. Castings also can hold much tighter tolerances, reducing the amount of machining typical to forgings.

Precision investment casting uses a ceramic mold that can produce a much smoother finish, typically averaging 125 Ra surface finish as cast. Investment castings also greatly reduce the amount of machining that will be required after casting by holding a .005”/inch tolerance for the majority of applications.

Our casting process can cut down labor time and offer one continuous part that has a consistent and clean look to the end user. The reduction of labor time reduces lead times and cost of castable applications. The consistency in castings can also lead to lower scrap, lowering final costs even further.

Investment castings reduce waste, labor time, and machine time that causes machining to be costly. PCC Aero's precision casting process, in tandem with PCC Aero's precision machining, can offer the best of both processes. The use of both processes allows us to give the best possible price for casting, but allowing the end user to be able to install threads, hold tight tolerances, and improve surface finish where necessary.

PCC Aero, Copyright © 2019

Design & Engineering

Design & Engineering

One of the top manufacturers of engineered fastening systems, metal components, and assemblies for aerospace, transportation and power generation markets.

Design & Engineering

×

Our Industrial Designers (I.D.) use a process involving research, brainstorming and concept generation to help extract that idea from your head. We have professional industrial designers that have put years into refining their sketching capabilities so you don’t have to worry about drawing. This, in conjunction with their creative ability to brainstorm alternative solutions, is how they design products and refine your idea down to the absolute best solution. They’ll not only add style but consider all user interactions to make sure your product works well.

Human Factors Engineering is the study of our interaction with the physical world around us, and the application of these principles in design. These interactions are especially relevant when designing a products to ensure that the user has a comfortable and intuitive experience. Our designers have this concept at the forefront of their mind during the design process to ensure the interaction is designed well.

Modern hardware is nothing without its digital counterpart: software. We’ll not only design the hardware, we’ll program the software that makes it tick. From complex, smart aerospace components to simple, programmable LED’s, we do it all. Our ability to see how the software integrates with and enhances the physical design makes for an efficient, hassle-free experience on the user’s end.

PCC Aero, Copyright © 2019

Superalloy Production

Superalloy Production

We produce commercially available vacuum melt nickel-base alloys for equiaxed, directionally-solidified and single crystal applications.

Superalloy Production

×

Nickel alloys are heat-resistant alloys used for jet engines and gas turbine blades. We started using the term “alloy design” after the phase computation (PHACOMP) method was developed in 1964 to predict the formation of harmful and brittle phases (e.g., σ phase) in nickel-based superalloys. This PHACOMP method has been widely used for the design and quality control of nickel-based superalloys.

Nickel-based alloys possess several properties which make them well suited for use in extremely severe conditions and environments. Nickel alloys are very resistant to oxidation and corrosion and when heated form a thick, stable, passivating oxide layer, protecting them from further attack. Nickel alloys also retain their strength over a wide range of temperatures. This makes them particularly attractive for use in high temperature applications.

To make Nickel Alloys, we start with the purest available raw materials to achieve the required chemical composition. A correct chemical composition is necessary to give uniform and required properties to different alloys. We have a completely integrated manufacturing facility; starting from the melting stage. Melting is performed in modern state-of-the-art vaccuum furnaces. We use special techniques to control impurities and inclusions. We employ unique processing techniques ensures consistency and high quality.

PCC Aero, Copyright © 2019

Global Services

Global Services

PCC Aero is positioned to provide unparalleled aftermarket support and comprehensive and cost-competitive service solutions for applications worldwide.

Global Services

×

From spare parts to innovative engineering solutions, our global aftermarket services offer superior worldwide support. Our parts are made to the same exacting quality, safety and comfort standards that you find in the product we originally delivered.

Today's sophisticated aerospace components and systems require expert engineering and support. That's why we provide industry-leading, comprehensive and responsive field service support anywhere in the world. Our field service engineers are highly trained technical experts who are routinely involved in every phase of program development, from design to test and integration. Their depth of involvement ensures an unsurpassed level of expert engineering support.

You can depend on us for fast response and quality support throughout the world. From commercial, space and power applications to critical military situations, PCC Aero delivers reliable support anywhere, anytime. Our Field Support teams provide complete service and support throughout the life cycle of your program and our products. We tailor our offerings to meet your operational requirements and reduce total cost of ownership. Our extensive network of experts around the globe dedicated to providing you with a level of support that builds trust every day.

PCC Aero, Copyright © 2019
